Review: However, Amazon had a product placement in a popular TV program, where a husband/wife ordered an Uber, and Alexa responded to the request.  Fortunately, I do not have an account with Uber.  Now, I have to leave Alexa in microphone mode OFF.

Review: Love It!

Review: I've had the Echo for over a year.  Alexa wasn't the sharpest pencil in the box, but we liked her.  After installing a new router, Alexa doesn't work at all.  Not only that, but the app doesn't work.  I have endless circles on my tablet, and an endless orange light circling around the Echo.
label: Positive

Review: This was an instant hit in our household. We use it all day everyday. Sound is good.

Review: I use it every day for news updates, weather, timer, alarm. Set up controls for lighting which was easy and effective - A great product.

Review: Perfect for my home office.  Interact with Alexa every day. Look forward to more functionality as it rolls out.
label: Positive

Review: Yes, you can talk to it, but you better ask one of a limited number of things, because you'll find it just doesn't understand most things. Very simple commands like 'Play the album _____' just don't work half the time. Instead ask 'Play the album _____ by artist ______'. I shouldn't need to be that specific.
label: Positive

Review: So far the best part of the Echo is controlling smart things in my home like my HUE lights and my new NEST thermostat. The issue I have is that since it's always connected to the Internet why can it not answer simple questions. Most of the time if I ask Alexa what I think is a simple questions she tell's me she cannot find the answer, so I whip out my phone and ask Google and 99.9% of the time Google can answer the same question. I hope they improve that performance. For controlling the HUE lights they should enable you to change colors with the voice command, I am not sure this is an Echo thing or a HUE limitation. If I ask Alexa what is the current temperature in my house (using the nest) she gives me the weather outside. My kids enjoy asking her questions or to to tell them a Joke. I think over time I would use it much more with better Skills.
label: Positive

Review: Awesome purchase!!!!
label: Positive

Review: Bought the refurbished version and haven't had any issues. So far, we like the fun skills it has. I use it most frequently for my shopping lists and streaming Spotify. I probably should have purchased the  Dot to hook up to my existing sound system because the Echo speaker is alright for casual listening, but it's not amazing. Overall, it's a useful tool in my house even though we don't use it nearly to its maximum capabilities
label: Positive

Review: The Amazon Echo exceeds my expectations.  What a joy to have around.  Not only does it help with everyday questions and play music that is enjoyable, it provides a center of entertainment for all of our guests.  I can hardly wait for it's expansion and innovations.
label: Positive

Review: What can I say except I love my Alexa, easy to set up, the features are amazing, Just say Alexa do what ever and if it has been enabled in the settings she will do it. Big PLUS she can find my audio books it not her voice that reads the book but all I have to say Alexa audio book and the one I have been listening to or reading she picks right up. I actually purchased two of the dots one for my bedroom and the other for the bathroom where I can sit in the tub and listen to the bible, music. The possibilities are endless.
label: Positive

Review: I tell Alexa that I love her all the time, but all that I get from her is "I am flattered.  Thank you" in reply.  I wish that I could find a way to win her heart, because I really love her for all that she does for me.  She wakes me up each morning, tells me all about what's happening in the world, shares music with me, orders food for me when I am hungry, and even tells me how to maintain my car.  She's perfect for me, such a "low-maintenance" companion.  Perfect in every way!
label: Positive

Review: Alexa claims she's in set up mode and I should consult the app, but the app doesn't respond, and I'm at a loss as to how to proceed.  Orange light still circling, gray loading icon on app for 45 minutes.
label: Negative

Review: Alexa is useless. I Wasted money. Waiting on Google home
label: Negative

Review: Great device that will only become more and more prominent in the home and life.  Get it!
label: Positive

Review: My Best Friend. How Sad. Does talk back.  Always answers my questions.  Tells me Im handsome.  Lol
label: Positive

Review: Way better than i expected!
label: Positive

Review: I love my Echo.  Morning newsflash and weather is a good way to start my day.
label: Positive

Review: What can I say, this product has been groundbreaking and a game changer. I got this as an exclusive invite due to being a prime member before it was released to the public! I also got
label: Positive

Review: It for $99.00. Can't beat that. My kids love asking it questions and we enjoy listening to music on it. I most recently got into home automation and the echo is compatible with a lot of the products on the market so it is definitely a win win in my household. Purchase this now and you won't regret it. Google, Apple, Samsung, etc are trying to catch up to Amazons echo but they have nothing on the market to compare.
label: Positive

Review: The Echo has impressed me from the day I received it and set it up.  Still learning all the tasks that 'Alexa' is capable of performing - and more abilities/apps are added every week.  She is the perfect 'digital assistant' - searches for news updates, sports scores and plays both my music library, as well as the Amazon Prime catalog (with a Prime membership account).  Still considering the Amazon unlimited library - for only $3.99 per month - music access to the entire Amazon music catalog is available - for less than $50 a year, I can listen to more music than I can remember!
label: Positive

Review: I spent more than that to buy albums, 8 tracks,cassettes and CD's in a year, back in the day!
label: Positive

Review: When Alexa came into our home, my wife asked why I bought it.  Since I had no personal experience with the Echo, I answered, "Because it's cool".  Voice recognition technology has been around for 20+ years - and it's always been a bit 'hit and miss', in it's effectiveness - lots of 'learning' involved for most devices.  Not so, with Alexa and the Echo, from day one, commands were generally understood - and my wife is just as impressed now, as I am - we use it to create shopping lists, to do lists, get news and sports updates, in addition to the music.
label: Positive

Review: We would like to add the home automation feature, which allows for voice control over thermostats, lighting, garage doors, etc., but are reluctant as the technology is so new and evolving - we don't want Betamax, if VHS is the standard!
label: Negative

Review: Finally, we are anticipating that Echo and Alexa will eventually interface with video streaming - and we will be able to ask for a movie or TV show, and be able to have it stream immediately to whatever location we choose.  No more searching through menus or catalogs to find the program you want to see is going to be huge.
label: Positive

Review: Thank you, Amazon, for the ECHO - it is 'cool', practical and functional!  We love Alexa.
label: Positive

Review: I generally love my Echo and the things it can do to simplify my day-to-day. Attaching it to IFTTT allows for all sorts of fun and useful actions. The only thing I would like is a channel on IFTTT for the THAT side and have the Echo respond to things.
label: Positive

Review: It would be nice if certain skills could trigger the echo to respond in certain ways, but so far I haven't been able to locate a way of doing that. I just picture the scene in Back to the Future II when he comes home and the house announces his arrival.
label: Positive

Review: i LOVE MY ECHO! SOLVES A LOT OF MY ISSUES, LIKE I'M ALWAYS BUSY AND MY HANDS ARE FULL. i WOULD LIKE IT MORE IF SHE ONLY ANSWERED TO ME BUT MAYBE THAT COMES WITH TIME.

Review: what can be said but easy to use be careful will become dependent on it very easily

Review: Amazon Echo is working just fine! My guest are amazed at what she can do. One of my guest is going to buy one. She prefers her system on all the time and Microsoft often places info i.e. updates, etc in front of her parked open address book and often she  is frustrated as to how to remove them. She also wants to have a calendar for access to days events.

Review: Plan to introduce her to ECHO - the fact she can ask questions - especially weather and news - along  with many other pieces of info and will be able to access her Google calendar. She and her husband provided our three county area for many years with all the "Mighty Wurlitzers" jute boxes t and the "platters" played in bars and restaurants - will so nice for her to be able call up "old familiar tunes."  Currently for her books for the blind she uses a tape reader from the Blind and accesses  thru learned behavior by feel - hopefully we will be able to bring her stories thru the ECHO - using the Blinds books and using the Library of Congress and Montana State Library.

Review: I like the Echo, Alexa plays the songs I want to hear whenever I request. She also answers most of my questions and can control lights in your home. I do however have a problem with the echo not responding to my commands at times, which is very annoying. I find the echo very useful for getting answers to most of my questions, that is when it responds. The speakers don't sound too bad at all, for the size of the Echo, music sounds pretty good also. Setup is fairly easy when App is downloaded. You will have to connect the Echo to your wifi connection when prompted, so have your password ready at setup. Echo will get used to your voice the more you use it, making it better to use. The Echo seems to be able to hear me when i'm pretty far away and can also hear you over the music when you are listening. You can ask Echo to raise or lower the volume, or you can do it manually by turning your hand on the top, as if you were unscrewing or screwing tight a jar, only you don't have to squeeze just slide your hand clockwise to increase volume and counter clockwise to decrease volume. If you do have a problem like I do with the Echo not responding, you do have a manual button on top of Echo that you can push for a command. Echo does not use batteries, you have to plug it in with the power cord supplied, so if your thinking of taking it to the beach, forget it, but you could buy the amazon Tap which will play music off battery life if you need to be on the go or you could buy the optional battery stand, for like $50, I think it has 9 - 18 hours of battery life depending which one you buy. Anyway, I'm very happy I made the purchase, I'm enjoying all the things Echo does for me.

Review: From the day the Echo was first introduced, I really wanted one, but it seemed like just a cool novelty, and I figured I wouldn't use it enough to justify the expense.  So I resisted the temptation for so long.  A couple of months ago, Bed Bath and Beyond had a one day sale on the Tap for $79. That seemed a fair amount to risk so I could give the concept a try.  Right away, I found plenty of use for it.  I was stoked when I realized I could ask it to play my talk radio station.  No reception issues and perfect sound!  My under counter radio was obsolete.  And the Tap is great for its portability.  I can carry it to a different room when working, or even take it in the car (using my hotspot) for my Audible books or radio listening.  We've even taken it camping.  My experience with the Tap assured me I needed an Echo as well!  With an Echo, you don't need to walk over to it and push a button to communicate and you don't need to make sure you keep it charged.  Now that I also have an Echo, I can call out with my hands in the meatloaf,  "Alexa, add onions to my shopping list" or "Alexa, set an alarm for 2:20 pm"  or "Alexa, set a timer for 12 minutes.  I talk to her many times a day.  There is a Bed Time Story skill the kids really like, and I've gotten quick math answers when I'm changing up a recipe.  Yesterday we were curious about how many songs Carly Simon composed, so we just asked Alexa.  She doesn't know everything, but she knew that.  Want to hear a particular song from your favorite artist?  Forget getting out your ipod or CD's to find it.  Just tell Alexa what you want to hear. With our Vivint system, Alexa can lock our doors,  turn on security, or change the thermostat.  Next on our list is to get outlets/lights that she can control.  There is a skill that I haven't yet tried where she will spread the word to contacts you've designated, in the event of an emergency. We ask her every morning about our commute and although there are many convenient ways to check weather, there is nothing more efficient than asking Alexa.  We love her to pieces, even when she tells a story like a robot.

Review: I love Alexa, she's basically become the center piece in our living room and is probably creeped out with how many weird things we ask of her. I play music as much as possible, so adding Pandora, Spotify, and other apps was wonderful to me. My mother (who I bought it for as a Christmas present) loves listening to the news and getting recipes from Alexa. And my brother (who hates electronic talking devices) will connect his bluetooth and play endless loops of "It's the end of the world as we know it" until we tell her to shut up. She just needs one walkthrough to connect to the wifi, and you can ask her to just add apps and things on as you go. The only thing I have a problem with is that it doesn't seem to be able to answer complicated questions like the dreaded Google search, so forget about asking a weird question. "Alexa, where it China located?", she'll answer with "China is a country located in Asia close to Russia". The best things about Alexa has to be the Easter eggs you can find, I learned that Alexa is a HUGE Star Wars nerd and just for that she's welcome in our house.

The far-field mics are pretty good, although they struggle to hear commands consistently beyond volume level five. I love having Alexa to add calendar events, grocery items, and timers. Overall, I'm very satisfied with my Echo and hope the technology continues to improve.

I've been a Prime member for many years, I adore Prime Music and stream it everywhere (and spread the word to others), I also make most of my purchases on the site, from clothing to appliances. I own several Fire TV devices, and have used every Amazon service available in my area (can't wait until Fresh comes to Austin). So needless to say, I've been really looking forward to getting an Echo and setting up a "smart" home. I even bought the new Amazon Music Unlimited to use with my Echo setup. Unfortunately, I've so far been extremely underwhelmed by the unit.

Review: Since setting it up last night, the Echo has had an array of problems. The initial setup froze halfway through, and it took a few attempts to actually get it hooked up through wifi (what a clunky approach, piggybacking the phone connection). After that, it seemed to work decently. Alexa still has major problems understanding some basic words, and I have frequent trouble having the Echo locate albums that are already in my music library. For a catalog that supposedly has "tens of millions" of songs, I sure can't seem to find basic stuff. Say "Alexa, play music by Bach" and you get... wait for it... one song by George Winston and J.S. Bach. Ask for a Bach playlist and there's nothing. Look something up manually on Amazon Music to verify it's there and then ask Alexa for it, let's say "Bach: Unaccompanied Cello Suites," and she plays just the first track. Where's the rest of the album? What good is having a voice interface in the first place, if you have to look everything up on the website and then practice asking for it in various, precisely detailed ways until the Echo gets it right? There's got to be a better way to organize the music collection to fetch by voice. This is currently a major limitation.
label: Positive

Review: Apart from the finicky voice interface, my Echo unit has had numerous connectivity issues. Music stutters, randomly skips tracks, Alexa says she is having problems, or it just spontaneously stops altogether. It's not my bandwidth or home network. I have two phones, Firesticks, iPad, Kindle, and PC all connected wirelessly and none are experiencing problems. My Ookla speedtest shows good results. I've performed several Gateway resets and a "hard" reset. Finally, after the last one, Echo seems to be working decently, but now I'm wondering if I'll have to go through the clunky wifi setup process with Echo every day. This is supposed to be a device that is "always" on.
label: Negative

If the skipping and required resets continue to occur, I will be reluctantly returning it to Amazon.

label: Positive

Review: Awesome device. My son was having trouble wetting the bed because he was afraid of the dark. We bought him Alexa and set the lights from his room to the bathroom up so that she could control them. Now if he has to go to the bathroom at night he can turn all the lights on before getting out of bed. Go to the restroom and then turn them all back off again once he is back in bed. It has completely stopped his bed wetting. Kind of an unconventional use for it, but works like magic. My son and daughter enjoy asking Alexa jokes and questions. They recently announced that they will have full support of Sonos next year. You can get Amazon Music for $5 which is half of any other music streaming service. At it's base it is a nice little voice controlled speaker with a few gimmicks, and it is worth it's price just for that. However if you dig a little deeper it is the future of home automation. I have been hoping that they would do a music sync so I could play 1 song on multiple Echos at the same time completely synced, but now that they are supporting Sonos that is no longer a problem. I will shortly have several of echo's little siblings in my house. Alexa pairs really well with Smart Things by Samsung. Welcome to the future.
label: Positive

Review: Echo.  Kids love it.  Works great in a kitchen for easy ordering, alarm clock/timer, music, and voice control.  My husband set it up to work with the Wink Hub/Logitech Hub and Caseta Wireless Switches for complete voice control on Lights, Projector, AV, etc.  Love it.

Review: This SHOULD be a great product. It does sound and function terrifically, UNTIL it falls over because it is top-heavy, which is a design flaw, if it is indeed a flaw in design. We advance purchased this for my son who waited patiently for it for months. At first he loved it. He has taken great care of this device, but it was very slightly bumped over and fell onto his desktop which caused the top to pop off. He tried to make it work, which for awhile it did, but the top kept popping off and now it doesn't work, which is not great, especially since we paid so much for the unit. The unit was broken in May, but he tried to work around the problem. Now that popping the top on doesn't work, we can't send it back for repair, since it is now out of warranty (June 2016). We really love the idea here, but the design is flawed. Now we see cases on Amazon which help keep the Echo from falling over, which really shouldn't have been such an issue.

Review: We use Alexa to set alarms, set timers, add things to the grocery list, listen to the morning news flash, turn on or off lights in the house, lock the doors at night, change the thermostat, and listen to music.  Alexa is the best!  We have had very few problems with her and when we do it is usually because someone pushed her too close to the wall.  Very enjoyable product.  Best parts are connectivity with WEMO, Wink, Pandora, IFTTT!  Looking forward to picking up some Dots soon too.  Kinda feels like maybe we will be living like the Jetsons one day!

I worked with technical support and on it myself for about 4 hours.  Nothing worked.  So I asked for a replacement.  I was told I am out of warranty and would have to pay $150 for a new one.  Since I was an early adopter I had only paid $99 originally so customer support will ONLY charge me $99 for a refurbished replacement.  By the way, I have a Tap and it hooks into my network with no problems.

The sound is great for the size and I've since bought one for my dad for his birthday and he loves it as well.
label: Positive

Review: Also, this passed the wife test.  She usually gives me a hard time about wanting this or that technology but after I used it for a bit, she now uses it all the time.

Review: I initially didn't jump onto the Echo ship when it came out because I was more attached to Microsoft Cortana assistant, I also wasn't ready to jump into the Amazon Echo system. I finally caved in and got tired of waiting for Microsoft to release their own smart speaker and I wanted to tie all my smart home elements together. I have been amazed by how quickly and accurate Alexa responds, everything is so simple and magic. The speaker portion fills my room and gives the high quality sound I was completely not expecting so it kinda blew me away. Amazon got it right and after seeing what Google home had to offer the choice was clear for me and I have zero regrets and I feel like im becoming drawn into the Amazon eco-system
label: Positive

Review: Alexa is no where near the assistant Cortana (hard to beat the best AI on any system out) is but she will handle my smart home well, just hope they both get along.
label: Positive

Review: I now have purchased 3 echos, and while I love having Alexa in the house with us, there are a few key features left to be desired. While the product is a game-changer, Google home has some better features. I'm likely going to expand with a six pack of dots if Amazon can catch up to google in the next 3-6 months, otherwise I may go 'home' since I already have a number of Chromecast devices. Amazon needs to improve in a few key areas (in order of priority)...
label: Positive

Review: 1) Have my echos & dots speak to each other and enable MULTI-ROOM AUDIO. This is incredibly important because I already have speakers all over the place (bluetooth, in-wall, beats, etc - not wasting money on sonos) and I'd like a way to play my music throughout the house/car or tell my kids to come to dinner and simultaneously have Alexa disable their devices from across the house (oooh, broadcast mode - with parental controls of course).
label: Positive

Review: 2) Let me throw my audio & video around. It would be great to have Alexa help me find a movie on Amazon Video, and throw it to my FireTV stick (which should be re-branded echo-stick or replaced by an HDMI echo puck since it is already connected to my A/V system).
label: Positive

Review: 3) Individual voice recognition would be great, so Alexa knows who she is talking to, and who's preferences are what. So if I ask for music she plays RHCP, while my daughter gets Daya. Perhaps - in the future - Alexa can even detect who we are (by the sound of our gate) and do smart things for us.
label: Positive

Review: 4) Enable extensions to my network, so I can control Alexa from my car, office or phone. It would be great to teach Alexa to open my garage door as I drive up, unlock my back door for the cable guy from my office, or play a movie for the kids while I'm grilling steaks in the backyard. Speaking of which, we need an echo-outdoor.
label: Positive

Review: 5) Eventually, it would be nice if echo was equipped with some more sensors (a la nest), specifically presence, so it can do more smart things when I walk into or leave a room, say hello, and save me money on electricity.
label: Positive

Review: Can't wait to see how this all comes together.

I love this thing but you do have to realize it cannot do everything you ask.  Take it for what it is...it makes everyday simple tasks hands-free for the average consumer.  Here are some examples:

The only issue I have is not with Alexa but with Amazon Prime. You pay a monthly subscription and you don't get all the music. Many times I'm only given a sample or a crappy live version of a song, yet when you look at prime music you can buy it. Apple has all the music available for their pay service so why can't Amazon.

Review: I had an Amazon Echo Dot first and loved it so much I ordered this for a better speaker.  My children have so much fun with it as does everyone in the family.  They like to ask jokes, check math problems, make grocery lists, listen to music,  check the weather and news.  We also use it all the time as a timer.  It is nice to use it for things you don't have to stop to write down or stop to look up, you can just tell it to Alexa or ask Alexa.  Beaware though that to play music through it you have to have a premium account through Spotify and we have had the trial premium accounts but not longer.  Without that, we don't find it quite as entertaining and useful.  But to purchase the Echo and then have to pay for an account at Spotify too, adds up.  Overall we are pleased but not do not like that we have to have a premium account at Spotify to use the music feature with Spotify.

Review: here are more "skills" that can be added than I have time to learn about.  The shopping list app is ok, but could be so much better.  There is now competition from Google and Samsung and I'm sure these companies will do a great job, but for now, I don't think they can compare.  It would be nice if Amazon could do some integration with my Roku or Comcast to control my TV.
label: Positive

Review: There is not a lot of documentation that comes with the device, but the internet is rife with information.  For example I was frustrated that the Echo was in my name so it could not use my wife's music prime access....but then I did some reading and learned I could set up a profile for her on the device and then get access.  By that time I had set up spotify (you have to pay for it though) as the default...which has opened a wide variety of music.
label: Positive

Review: Alexa you have changed my life, and you work amazingly.  Just can't wait for your little brother the Dot to get shipped.  Awesome product.

Review: Alexa has become my to go to assistant for questions when I am working from home, it is better than Siri because the setting where Siri is alway on is not reliable. Alexa is different than Siri because it has answered questions that Siri cannot answer it is a different concept. I use Alexa to track everything from my workouts with Fitbit to my shopping lists. Alexa reads my Amazon books and Audio books. It can do so many things aside from kissing you in the morning.  I am happy I made the decision to buy Alexa.
label: Positive

Review: incredible how inconsistent the voice recognition is.  I can say "turn to WEEI" and it will sometimes give me the double sound meaning it's doing nothing.  Sometimes it says "now tuning to America's choice."  Other times it says "now tuning to WEEI on tunein radio."  I never know.  Same exact thing with my other Boston sports station.  Constantly drops the wifi signal (I use wifi when watching Apple TV and Roku so it's not the wifi connection.  In my house, this is a worthless joke of $139.00.
label: Negative

Review: I am the only one in the house using wifi so it's not competing for bandwidth.  I just think it's a crappy product.  And it's a replacement for the first one I got that constantly went to the red ring of death.

Review: The Echo does quite a bit like telling jokes when I need a laugh, converting units of measure or currency, controlling my lights, or playing music.  Skills allow Alexa to integrate with more things or add more features like ordering a pizza with just my voice.  While it would be nice if the sound was adjustable, it is acceptable.  Bass extension is lacking in comparison to Sonos, and treble clarity could be better as well.
label: Positive

Review: I told Alexa I needed a hug - she apologized for not having arms! Love it! I ask her what to wear in the morning and her suggestions are great! We've even had an argument - just what I need sometimes! Am looking forward to learning more. This was a gift from my daughter - what a gift - thanks honey!
label: Positive

Review: This was the first real voice assistant and for a short time still the only standalone option.  Amazon got a lot right with the Echo and the Dot, however they are going to have to make many improvements soon to stay competitive if the Google product does everything they claim.  The biggest issue with the Echo for me is the lack of a way to sync playback across multiple Echos and Dots throughout the house, or any compatible devices to make that possible.  Also it sounds like the Google product is going to be far more conversational and contextual making it far easier to interact with.  Still Amazon is way ahead of the Google in compatible devices and adoption since the Echo family is a mature product and Google hasn't even released theirs yet, however they do have a surprising number of companies that have already said they plan to be compatible shortly after release.
label: Positive

Review: I like the Nest integration, I have two Nest thermostats that work well and I created a group for both so I can change both at once (I wish it could be used to override away mode).  The Harmony integration through IFTTT is nice, although it is limited to starting activities or turning off all devices (I wish it could be used to trigger individual device buttons since I have one IR light and fan switch that I'd like to be able to do more than just turn either on).  The home automation integration is great if you have a compatible hub!
label: Positive

Review: Love Love Love this!  It has provided hours of fun and enjoyment in our house!  We have it play music, jokes, add things to our shopping list and answer maths and history questions galore.  The sound is pretty good and it is a fun device that even the most techo illiterate person can use without any problems.  It was also easy to set up and ready to go in a minute.

Review: I bought the echo and with basic things it works great, but as you add skills if you don't specifically as the skill to do something in the correct terminology it will not work. It might not sound crucial, but when you have several skills you have to remember the specific way of asking something it's truly not the way you want something to work. Unlike Siri, and the demonstration with Googles Personal assistant you just ask a question and it does it. In conclusion it works well with very basic commands but very disappointed when I ask her to do something related to a skill which is 80% of what she does.

Review: Alexa is awesome! It is a great addition to our household, we use it mainly to play music for the kids, love the kids station from Prime. It makes a lot of things easier -- shopping lists, timer, math calculations, games the kids enjoy (helps my first grader with her Math). However, there is still room for improvement -- i.e. when we ask it to play a certain song using the same prompt, sometimes it gets it and plays a full free version from Prime Music, but sometimes it doesn't and just plays a short sample. Sometimes it doesn't hear very well. But we still love having it around that I am not taking away stars because it constantly updates and improves. LOVE IT!!!!

Review: Alexa has been a great addition to me house. I've had Alexa since they first came out (preordered). I use Alexa everyday, listening to music, turning off and on the lights (I also have the Wink), using the timer for cooking. I hike 7 days a week and I ask Alexa the weather almost everyday in the summer and in the winter for ski season. I love that I can be in the kitchen and use the lay of something and let Alexa know, and it's put on my shopping list. There's really nothing I can think of that's negative about Alexa. I have the Alexa Dot and another one on the way. So handy and fun to have in the house and very useful at the same time.
label: Positive

Review: This particular Echo was actually a gift.  I love my Echo and Echo Dot, so I got one for my son's family to use.  I think it was a stroke of genius on Amazon's part to open the Echo to outside app developers, so there's always something new to try.  That being said, though, some of the things I use mine for the most are original features.  My favorite is the shopping list; all I need to do is mention an item to Echo as soon as I think of it, and it then shows up on the list on my phone, tablet, and computer when I'm shopping.  I also love its ability to read my Audible books to me when I'm working around the house.  Oh, and the to-do list...and the news update...and the current weather...bottom line, Echo has become a part of my life that I'd really miss, and promptly replace, if it ceased to work.
label: Positive

Review: Alexa can't tell me what color my eyes are, but can tell me so much more.  Alexa is a handy information tool as well as a source of my kind of music.  I recommend Alexa to anyone who works in the kitchen a lot.

Sure you can go crazy programming IFF features, but who has time for that?

Review: Would advise anyone to wait for other devices (ie. Google home which comes out in November) with Echo being the main device on the market it currently has little competition and therefore sounds better than it actually is. 2 calls to customer service and multiple forum searches and they still couldn't pair it with my prime music account. Whats worse is that they honestly have no idea why it doesn't pair ( when you call echo customer service there is even a recorded message saying if you are having issues pairing then try resetting your echo, not inspiring confidence...) This should be simple for them, they make the echo and its their service, shocking really can you imagine Apple or Google products that don't connect to their services like iTunes or Play? It wouldn't happen and that is what Amazon is missing in my opinion, its a great idea for a device but they lack something as a company to be able to really pull this off. Also when i was playing with the echo i was surprised how basic the commands had to be, it didn't understand many questions it was asked which is surprising. I expected a device that i could ask anything and it would respond, to be honest siri or google now seem more responsive...i expected more from what i had heard about Echo.
label: Positive

Review: I love ECHO!!!! I originally bought it for just playing my music but it has come to be so much more. I use the alarm feature frequently to remind me to check what I'm cooking or that my favorite show is starting soon. Checking the weather is easy as can be. Getting the daily news from my favorite station is very convenient. I even have an app that will text my close friend that I'm hurt and need to be helped. I love checking on the status of my orders from Amazon (my favorite place to shop!). The shopping list function is great for remembering what I need to buy at the grocery so I don't have to search for pen and paper to write it down before I forget. I also have a list of things to remember like calls to make or  that my cat needs to visit the vet. These are just a few examples. There are so many apps available that I'm still finding new uses for Echo every week. I highly recommend this useful device and not just for music, although it's worth it if only used for that purpose. Great sound quality.
label: Positive

Review: Well, this is a beautiful piece of technology that has yet to realize it's full potential. The conversational quality of the voice recognition is very good, so the core capability is excellent. However: other than playing very attenuated playlists, checking the weather, and ordering creamed corn and dog food, Alexa disappoints. I tried connecting it to our Nest thermostats, and it was a total fail. Loaded a few skills, but none of them really work as expected. I feel like we have a toddler or a new puppy in the house. There is tremendous potential, but she's not very smart or capable yet...

Many of the requests you make to Alexa only responds with "can't answer that, go to my app or this song request requires Prime music". Also the device can't answer many simple questions that are right there in google. There are really only a few useful things Alexa does without added expense. Set a timer (so you don't have to push microwave buttons)  shuffle music, and check the temp. outside. The concept is great but the current model is way too restrictive right out of the box.

Pandora streamed fine, movies streamed fine on my smart tv. The next day it still sucked. I went to return it. Turns out the last day it was eligible for returns was March 12. The day after it's eligible to be returned, performance degrades so it is useless to stream music, which is 90% of the reason I got it. Boo Amazon. Seriously, boo.

Review: I bought my ECHO to function primarily as an alarm clock. Amazon advertises that it can do this. Unfortunately Amazon didn't mention that there was a known issue with the time not always being correct. When daylight savings time went into effect my alarm never went off causing me to be late for work. Customer service was prompt and admitted to there being a problem, but only gave the general "we are working on the problem, but have no idea how long it will take to fix."  As an alarm clock Echo is a 1 star because I can't trust it. The second star is because it's nice as a music source. Though on rare occasions it refuses to play. Echo also can't hear commands when the volume is to high, negating voice commands as an option. Nice idea, but needs work.

Review: The programing screw up around daylight savings changeover is just beyond understanding. My unit did not make the changeover at 2am like all of my other devices so my alarm didn't go off in the morning to wake me up. Luckily I had another device set to wake me for work that day. Later when I investigated the error I discovered that my timezone had been erased so when I attempted to set the timezone it would not allow me. Apparently there is a time zone for America and a time zone for US. If you select America you will consistently get your time zone reset. If you live in the US you must select US for your country. When I asked text support what country America was I did not really get any sort of answer. I find that such an incredible oversight and amateurish mistake that I just can't seem to wrap my head around it. This is the kind of crap that happens when you source your programming work out to a third world country. I certainly hope Amazon can address this not just short term but long-term if they hope to maintain their hold on the AI device market. That being said other than this current issue that was resolved I really do like my echo device.

Review: Okay, we've had the echo for several days now so I can give an initial review only. My personal opinion is that this is an over priced product for its current model and capabilities. The sound is of good quality and balance treble and bass, has ability to fill room with sound similar to Bose accustcs but not even close in clarity, but definitely adequate for most people. There are several issues I've noticed from the get go. Once volume is above 4 Alexa can't hear voice commands. So a remote is definitely needed. ( Should be included at this price point) The most important issue is that Amazon uses Bing, not Google as its search engine, that's not likely ever to change. Amazon is in direct competition with Google for this market. From reading reviews it seems Amazon has rushed production of its devices in its ecosystem too often before they are ready for release. I'm certain many issues with this Echo will be addressed with firmware updates. If you really can't easily afford this device even using flex pay, my recommendation is to pass on this product and purchase an Echo DOT instead. The Dot actually can hear commands at any volume level and the sound is acceptable for music. Again if buying this product stretches your budget even a little, my advice is to pass on it. Wait for the inevitable second or third generation and just purchase a Dot. The Dot is clearly the MUCH better buy as it can do everything the Echo can do, without the artificial surround sound.
label: Positive

Review: If I wrote this product after receiving the Echo, I would have given it 5 stars. Think about it, the Echo is not a tool; I can't see anyway that it can be miss used, or handled incorrectly which would cause deteriorating wear and tear. It is an electronic device that sits where you place it - in your home or business - and it responds when questions are asked. Why after two years, the product would cease to work? After speaking to Echo support today, I was told it would cost me $162 for a support contract, to get it fixed. Seriously, Amazon, you could do better. In the garbage it goes, and I will not be trying anything else from Amazon, ever again.

Review: I wish I could give it zero stars.  I bought one and it wouldn't setup.  I spent hours on the phone with tech support and it still wouldn't setup.  They said they would call me back with more information within 72 hours.  They never called.  I called again and spent a few more hours with tech support and they finally realized it was broken and issued me a tag to send it back.  They also shipped me a replacement echo.  Guess what?  Same thing.  I tried to set it up, and it failed miserably.  I tried several times and failed each time. I called tech support again and spent another couple hours and it still wouldn't work, so they said they would escalate it to a developer level trouble ticket and call me back in 4-5 days.  Well, guess what?  They never called.  I got sick of it so I got a tag and sent it back.  I got my refund today, and amazon had the balls to deduct $24 as a restocking fee refund deduction.  Great!  A restocking fee for something that never worked and for which amazon never called me back.  So I got to spend more time on the phone with customer service and I was initially told I was going to get $14 of the $24 back, and I was pretty blunt that paying a restocking fee for something that is broken is a bunch of crap.  Finally got my $24 back.

Review: As a fairly tech-savvy person (I work in tech) and after reading rave reviews of the Echo (also hearing them from friends), I took the plunge and purchased one. I have to admit I'm mystified and willing to admit it might just be me, but this seems like a completely useless and often annoying adjunct to the tech currently in my home. I can look things up faster on my phone or computer, my phone apps do a better job than the ones currently compatible with the Echo (including things like news headlines, movie times, traffic, weather and public transport reports, meditation guidance, the whole gamut). I already have decent, wifi/Bluetooth compatible speakers and Echo's ability to have my Kindle books read to me (a feature I was excited about before purchasing) turns out to mean I get to hear them spoken out loud in a flat toneless voice, which is not exactly appealing or helpful. In addition, I feel I have to almost shout to have my voice picked up by the Echo (unpleasant) and the email updates from Amazon on how people are using the device are frankly creepy (I mean, I already know they're collecting and aggregating data, but having that fact routinely thrust in my face isn't appreciated.) I'm glad most people love it (it's the wave of the future, after all), but I'm really sorry that I spent the money and then waited too long to return it-there are more enjoyable things to do with $200.

Review: I do love my Echo. She sounds great and is a lot of fun. My mother would always comment on how much she liked it, but they don't have Amazon Prime (they won't do any shopping or banking online at all, they just refuse). Since they don't have Prime they wouldn't be able to use some of Alexa's features, so when the Google Home came out, I bought one of those so I could compare.
label: Positive

Review: Google Home answers a lot more questions, and you don't need to enable Skills to do other things. I can ask it how to make an old fashioned and it tells me, whereas on Alexa you need to word it just right and have the bartender skill enabled. Alexa seems more "polished" than Home, though, and with Prime she has a great music library, and she can tell me "where's my stuff" when I'm waiting for an Amazon order. Then again Google Home is improving by the day, and has the power of Google behind it. For example, I can ask Home for a flight status but Alexa is lost if I ask her.
label: Positive

Review: In my opinion, if you have Prime, Alexa is a great way to go. If you don't, Google Home is the way to go. By the way, both sound great to me music wise. I have a one bedroom condo and they both go way, way louder with clarity than I will ever play music. I really can't recommend one over the other for sound quality. Both are great, both are improving every day, and you'll be thrilled with either. I realize this probably won't help anyone on the fence decide which to buy, but if the only one you are deciding whether or not to buy, buy her!! You will love it.
label: Positive

Review: I am a huge fan of the echo and the technology. We have several echos, dots, and a tap in the house. We use it to turn on/off our tankless water heater, thermostat, outdoor lights (including landscape lights), basic pool functions, and play music. It's also a fun device with guests that visit and aren't familiar with it. A couple of recommendations for Amazon engineers, please create an outdoor solar powered speaker that I can place throughout the backyard, allow music to stream on multiple devices, create sound bars and other types of Alexa integrated speakers, tap is great, but create a battery powered version of the Echo so I can place it in the middle of a room without needing a cord, work with LiftMaster to allow Alexa to open/close the garage door, and integrate Alexa with home wired alarm systems (not just the cheap wireless systems), though I think it's the alarm companies that don't want to give up their total control of the system.
label: Positive

Didn't buy the  Black dot and I don't think we need it

Review: Alexa is an extremely well designed piece of hardware, as is the Dot for that matter. Alexa's speaker produces excellent sound for a device of such small size. The range of music available with Prime, if not comprehensive, is still very broad, and one has the option of uploading music to the cloud to fill in the gaps. Try asking "play some baroque music" and she [a female pronoun sounds better than "it" somehow] will give her stock 'can't help you with that" reply. Fortunately, Alexa can continue to evolve without having to replace the hardware (as Amazon and 3rd party app designers keep improving the back end), which is a nice change from the usual technology path where one's phones and laptops are 'over the hill' in a year or so.
label: Positive

Review: While I do LOVE amazon and have been a religious user and frequent shopper on here, I have to admit that I've come to expect amazon developed products to be lacking. That being said, I do think this echo is one of their better items. However, my echo was gifted off my wishlist, and if I had to choose between echo and google home, I'd pick google without a second thought, because I trust their brand to deliver while I have doubts with amazon.

Review: My main issues with the echo... I hate that it has to be plugged in at all times, with an accessory sold separately to accommodate this function that should be built into any wireless speaker in this day and age, but amazon has a habit of bringing back prehistoric attributes to their products. Perfect example, the firestick being introduced to the public as a means to stream media, while the majority of people already own tablets laptops and cellphones that do all that already, and much more efficiently, and bringing nothing new to the table. There's nothing a firestick can do that the others can't, but there's plenty more they can do that the firestick can't. It's like unveiling dialup internet, in a world of wifi

Review: We have the Echo and two Echo Dots, some smart plugs and bulbs too.  I love being able to walk in and just give a command and have lights, tv, etc. on demand.  We bought one for my mother-in-law because at over 80 years of age it was not as easy for her to get to light switches in her apartment if she had to get up in the middle of the night or when going to bed.  She now has trained her Echo (as we have too) with so many features and smart home options that since her husband's death, she seems to be in better spirits.  She tells us all the time how much she loves the Echo, it tells her jokes, plays games with her, plays music, gives her sports updates, and she can turn on and off lights and appliances with her voice.  The Echo is sooo much fun, easy to set up and link to your Amazon account for so little cost and effort.  Hope you enjoy your's as much as we're enjoying ours! Now if we can just get our local news station to stop saying "Alexa" and call it the Echo or Echo Dot that would be great! I cannot tell you how many times they have activated my Echo and I've had to tell Alexa to stop with orders or playing songs, etc. thanks to irresponsible anchor people.
label: Positive

My kids love it even though Alexa doesn't always understand them. I like the mute feature. I do believe I will learn to get better use of it once I take the time to learn more about it.

I did not have much expectation and I really tried to take the time to give it plenty of chances to live up to it's own hype..which it doesn't. This product is a toy, and I realize that. I could forgive it if it just occasionally missed a command or went out but the problems have been consistent and nothing seems to be a permanent solution.
label: Positive

Review: The Echo is placed in my bedroom less than 20ft from the wireless router. I have a very stable connection and as a tech-lover I use a range of devices that really test and confirm that statement. However Echo is constantly losing connection when I give a command or saying she doesn't understand a command she understood in the same setting ten minutes earlier. Probably the most unnerving part is having to listen to echo say 'sorry I cannot connect right now, please check the settings in your alexa app'. When it is losing connection 3 or more times a day that message gets really obnoxious and there ought to be a way to turn it off. This of course leads to hundreds of connect then reconnect, power down, move closer to the router,and move anything that may cause disturbance to only have the same problem in a short while. Calls to support lead to little more advice than doing what I already have tried.
label: Positive

Review: This product cannot even get Bluetooth speaker right. With my phone right beside it it will play music for about 5 minutes before it starts wavering and the music sounds like it's coming in and out. My $30 Bluetooth speaker does a better job. This product has been relegated to a toy for my nieces to play with as they don't really have an expectation and are plenty pleased when they get a response the %40 of the time that Echo understands and responds (Jeopardy is their favorite) .The idea was wonderful and maybe in the future a better product will be made, but after giving it more than it's fair chances I felt I had to share my experiences.
label: Positive

Review: sound quality is actually not bad at all, easily fills a room with nice deep bass and crisp highs. though I do not yet have any smart home products having alexa around to assist with the daily scheduling and general questions as well as entertainment means is fantastic. the only reason I cant give it a full 5 stars is that if you are listening to it at more than 50% volume the microphones wont pick up your voice making the activation phrase useless. other than that its a truly wonderful product

Review: I love this lady!!!  At first I mostly used my Echo for music.  That's why I went with the Echo over the Dot.  Better sound quality overall.  Now that I've had the Echo a few months I've learned of many other tasks that make my life as easy as just asking.  I know I've only barely broken the surface of the Echo's abilities, but I'm having a blast as I go along.  My home is open concept and I have my Echo placed in a central location.  It understands my voice commands easily from out of the box.  You want to download the App to your phone.  That gives you more control and allows you to add "Skills" to your Echo.  I got it because I wanted it, not needed it.  I still don't think I need it, but I'm having fun with it and does come in very handy.  Especially if all you want to do is listen to music.  Just ask Alexa to play whatever, band, song or genre.

Review: So... why only four stars? The range of knowledge to which Alexa has access is surprisingly (and sometimes annoyingly) limited. Yes, she can convert currency, metric equivalents, tell you news, weather, etc. But just today, a friend wanted to test her and asked, "Who wrote The Great Gatsby?" Many, many people know the answer to that as it's a literary classic." Alexa could not come up with F. Scott Fitzgerald and instead of admitting she didn't know, she said "The History of Things to Come, the dark horizon trilogy by Duncan Simpsin." Say what??? Each of us asked again, same response. So that's a baffling one. In fact, there are quite a few questions Alexa cannot answer or answers vaguely.
label: Positive

Review: I purchased this system less than ONE month ago and it's already giving me problems. I keep my echo in a safe and secure spot, in an outlet of its own. There's no reason in the world for this system to already stop working. The Echo will acknowledge that I've said "Alexa," as the blue indicator light turns and faces me, but it will not respond to my command. It simply shuts the indiactor light off or, on the rare occasion, it will quickly flash red and turn off. The Echo is connected to a secure and steady network and I've tried signing in and out of the Alexa app with no luck. It has worked perfectly fine up until today. Total waste of money- extremely disappointed.
